instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Help with mini pro programmer please
threads.message:
Hey guys. Now I know that this isn't rocket but Im having a terrible time trying to get this programer to read any chip with QFN8 socket. 

S0P8 socket works fine. 

I have gotten it to work before but that was a while back. haven't really needed since. 


Here is pic of how I have it setup.

[url]https://photos.app.goo.gl/GBtHjV1hm3kKNiC36[/url]

threads.title: Help with mini pro programmer please
threads.message:
You mean WSON8 I suppose.
Check some pictures here...
[url]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/search?q=wson8&searchJSON=%7B%22keywords%22%3A%22wson8%22%7D[/url]

If you repair Apple stuff, then buy Medusa 2/3 programmer, with A4064/69 adapters.
[url]http://www.cmizapper.com/buy/medusa-3-accessories.html[/url]
